sentence.Network_en: After all, he hadn't seen her in her chemise for ever and ever so long.
sentence.Network_cn: 毕竟, 他已那么久那么久没有看见她穿这种无袖衬衣的模样了.

sentence.Network_en: Hastily she slipped off her wrapper and stood clad only in her chemise.
sentence.Network_cn: 她急忙把睡衣脱了,身上只剩下一件无袖衬衫.

sentence.Network_en: Overseas demand brisk lose no chemise make bid at suggest level.
sentence.Network_cn: 国外需求很旺盛,按所提供价格出价,勿失良机.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin camisia 'shirt or nightgown'

entry.def: A chemise is a long, loose piece of underwear worn by women in former times.

means.word_mean: 2. a loose-fitting dress hanging straight from the shoulders without a waist
